alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Aitkin, northern Pine, eastern Carlton and west central Douglas Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 522 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Sandstone, or 11 miles north of Hinckley, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Askov around 530 PM CDT. Willow River and Bruno around 535 PM CDT. Moose Lake around 540 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Nemadji, Holyoke and Foxboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota.
